description:
It's not a bad little calendar, might take a 
little while to get used to, but what I like 
is the fact that it is so small. Its files are 
under:
/home/yourname/.local/share/orage
and can be copied (saved etc)

I agree w Robin that there's a learning curve. Most db apps, such as a calendar, require adjustment to the data entry methods. I like how its storage is in a standard location. I only need a basic calendar, and this looks like just what I need.
summary: Supports ICS (iCalendar files) as default Calendar app in GNOME3

description: No 'Find' function and therefore useless to me.
Since Ubuntu Mate with version 20 eliminated the date on the Panel and only shows the time, I wanted an app which shows the date -- and Orage is exactly what I was looking to install and use.

Einfache klare Bedienung
Leider kann ein Termin einer Serie nicht gelöscht oder verschoben werden ohne die Serie zu beeinflussen
